00016 /* The position fields are stored as an array 
00017  * so that they are contiguous in memory: 
00018  * this MIGHT be necessary for the direct computation with BLAS, 
00019  * but this MIGHT be slower for the direct computation without BLAS!
00020  * We therefore let the two possibilities ...  
00021  *
00022  * After testing: the position fields stored as arrays are not slower 
00023  * for the direct computation without BLAS! */
00024 
00025 #ifdef _POSITION_T_STORED_WITH_ARRAY_ 
00026 
00027 #define POS_X 0
00028 #define POS_Y 1
00029 #define POS_Z 2
00030 typedef struct {
00031   COORDINATES_T dat[3];
00032 } position_t;
00033 
00034 #else /* #ifdef _POSITION_T_STORED_WITH_ARRAY_ */
00035 
00036 typedef struct {
00037   COORDINATES_T x;
00038   COORDINATES_T y;
00039   COORDINATES_T z;
00040 } position_t;
00041 
00042 #endif /* #ifdef _POSITION_T_STORED_WITH_ARRAY_ */
00043 
00044 
00045 
00046 
00047 
00048 
00049 
00050 
00051 /*! For the spherical coordinates we use the "physical" notation \n
00052   for theta and phi. That is to say that phi is the longitudinal
00053   coordinate whereas theta is the colatitudinal coordinate
00054   (the colatitudinal coordinate "starts" from the z-axis 
00055   whereas the latitudinal coordinate "starts" from the x-y plan 
00056   (i.e. the equator for the earth). */
00057 typedef struct { /* (r, theta, phi) */
00058   COORDINATES_T r;
00059   COORDINATES_T th; /* for "theta": theta is in the range [0, Pi] */
00060   COORDINATES_T ph; /* for "phi": phi is in the range ]-Pi, Pi] */
00061 } spherical_position_t;
00062

00070 FMB_INLINE void position_Set_x(position_t *FMB_RESTRICT p, COORDINATES_T v){  
00071   p->dat[POS_X] = v;  
00072 } 
00073 FMB_INLINE COORDINATES_T position_Get_x(FMB_CONST position_t *FMB_RESTRICT p){ 
00074   return p->dat[POS_X]; 
00075 } 
00076 FMB_INLINE COORDINATES_T *position_Get_p_x(position_t *FMB_RESTRICT p){ 
00077   return p->dat + POS_X; 
00078 }

00084   return p->dat[POS_Y]; 
00085 }

00087   return p->dat + POS_Y;

00089 #else /* #ifdef _POSITION_T_STORED_WITH_ARRAY_ */

00147 FMB_INLINE void position_Initialize(position_t *FMB_RESTRICT p){ 
00148   position_Set_x(p, (COORDINATES_T)0); 
00149   position_Set_y(p, (COORDINATES_T)0); 
00150   position_Set_z(p, (COORDINATES_T)0); 
00151 } 
00152 
00153 FMB_INLINE void position_Affect(position_t *FMB_RESTRICT p_to_affect, 
00154                                 FMB_CONST position_t *FMB_RESTRICT p_new_values){ 
00155   position_Set_x(p_to_affect, position_Get_x(p_new_values)); 
00156   position_Set_y(p_to_affect, position_Get_y(p_new_values));  
00157   position_Set_z(p_to_affect, position_Get_z(p_new_values)); 
00158 } 
00159 
00160 FMB_INLINE char position_Are_too_close(FMB_CONST position_t *FMB_RESTRICT p1, 
00161                                        FMB_CONST position_t *FMB_RESTRICT p2){ 
00162   return ((COORDINATES_T__ARE_ALMOST_EQUAL(position_Get_x(p1), position_Get_x(p2), COORDINATES_T_MAX_RELATIVE_ERROR)  
00163            && COORDINATES_T__ARE_ALMOST_EQUAL(position_Get_y(p1), position_Get_y(p2), COORDINATES_T_MAX_RELATIVE_ERROR) 
00164            && COORDINATES_T__ARE_ALMOST_EQUAL(position_Get_z(p1), position_Get_z(p2), COORDINATES_T_MAX_RELATIVE_ERROR)) ?  
00165           TRUE :  
00166           FALSE); 
00167 } 
00168 
00169 FMB_INLINE void position_Negate(position_t *FMB_RESTRICT p){ 
00170   position_Set_x(p, - position_Get_x(p)); 
00171   position_Set_y(p, - position_Get_y(p)); 
00172   position_Set_z(p, - position_Get_z(p)); 
00173 } 
00174 
00175 /* Because of the FMB_RESTRICT, we can not have: p_target==p_src. */ 
00176 FMB_INLINE void position_Add(position_t *FMB_RESTRICT p_target, 
00177                              FMB_CONST position_t *FMB_RESTRICT p_src){ 
00178 #ifdef _DEBUG_
00179   if (p_target == p_src){
00180     FMB_error("ERROR: in position_Add(p_target, p_src), p_target == p_src.\n");
00181   }
00182 #endif /* #ifdef _DEBUG_ */
00183   position_Set_x(p_target, position_Get_x(p_target) + position_Get_x(p_src)); 
00184   position_Set_y(p_target, position_Get_y(p_target) + position_Get_y(p_src));  
00185   position_Set_z(p_target, position_Get_z(p_target) + position_Get_z(p_src)); 
00186 } 
00187 
00188 /* Because of the FMB_RESTRICT, we can not have: p_target==p_src. */ 
00189 FMB_INLINE void position_Substract(position_t *FMB_RESTRICT p_target, 
00190                                    FMB_CONST position_t *FMB_RESTRICT p_src){ 
00191 #ifdef _DEBUG_
00192   if (p_target == p_src){
00193     FMB_error("ERROR: in position_Substract(p_target, p_src), p_target == p_src.\n");
00194   }
00195 #endif /* #ifdef _DEBUG_ */
00196   position_Set_x(p_target, position_Get_x(p_target) - position_Get_x(p_src)); 
00197   position_Set_y(p_target, position_Get_y(p_target) - position_Get_y(p_src));  
00198   position_Set_z(p_target, position_Get_z(p_target) - position_Get_z(p_src)); 
00199 } 
00200 
00201 FMB_INLINE void position_Mult_by_real(position_t *FMB_RESTRICT p_pos, 
00202                                       COORDINATES_T real){ 
00203   position_Set_x(p_pos, position_Get_x(p_pos) * real);  
00204   position_Set_y(p_pos, position_Get_y(p_pos) * real);  
00205   position_Set_z(p_pos, position_Get_z(p_pos) * real); 
00206 }

00210 FMB_INLINE COORDINATES_T position_Compute_square_distance(FMB_CONST position_t *FMB_RESTRICT p1, 
00211                                                           FMB_CONST position_t *FMB_RESTRICT p2){ 
00212   return ((position_Get_x(p1) - position_Get_x(p2)) * (position_Get_x(p1) - position_Get_x(p2)))  
00213     + ((position_Get_y(p1) - position_Get_y(p2)) * (position_Get_y(p1) - position_Get_y(p2)))  
00214     + ((position_Get_z(p1) - position_Get_z(p2)) * (position_Get_z(p1) - position_Get_z(p2))) ;  
00215 } 
00216 
00217 
00218 /* WARNING: the way this function is written may cause imbalance problems in terms
00219    of computation between leafs : there should be a better way of comparing positions 
00220    such that all leafs do roughly the same amount of computation in the direct computation
00221    phase ... */
00222 /* return: *p1 "<" *p2 */
00223 FMB_INLINE bool position_Is_lower(FMB_CONST position_t *FMB_RESTRICT p1, 
00224                                   FMB_CONST position_t *FMB_RESTRICT p2){
00225   if (FMB_FABS(position_Get_x(p1) - position_Get_x(p2)) < EPSILON)
00226     if (FMB_FABS(position_Get_y(p1) - position_Get_y(p2)) < EPSILON)
00227       if (FMB_FABS(position_Get_z(p1) - position_Get_z(p2)) < EPSILON)
00228         return FALSE;
00229       else
00230         return position_Get_z(p1) < position_Get_z(p2);
00231     else 
00232       return position_Get_y(p1) < position_Get_y(p2);
00233   else 
00234     return position_Get_x(p1) < position_Get_x(p2);
00235 }

00244 /*! The "prec" parameter should be equal to "low" when we want to display positions 
00245   of bodies, and equal to "high" when we want to display computed force vectors of bodies. */
00246 FMB_INLINE void position_Display(FMB_CONST position_t *FMB_RESTRICT p, 
00247                                  FILE *f, 
00248                                  precision_double_t prec){ 
00249   fprintf(f, "(");
00250 
00251   if (prec == low){
00252     fprintf(f, LOW_PRECISION_DOUBLE_FPRINTF, position_Get_x(p));
00253     fprintf(f, ", ");
00254     fprintf(f, LOW_PRECISION_DOUBLE_FPRINTF, position_Get_y(p));
00255     fprintf(f, ", ");
00256     fprintf(f, LOW_PRECISION_DOUBLE_FPRINTF, position_Get_z(p));
00257   }
00258   else {
00259     fprintf(f, HIGH_PRECISION_DOUBLE_FPRINTF, position_Get_x(p));
00260     fprintf(f, ", ");
00261     fprintf(f, HIGH_PRECISION_DOUBLE_FPRINTF, position_Get_y(p));
00262     fprintf(f, ", ");
00263     fprintf(f, HIGH_PRECISION_DOUBLE_FPRINTF, position_Get_z(p));
00264   }
00265   
00266   fprintf(f, ")");
00267 } 
00268

00273 /*! The "prec" parameter should be equal to "low" when we want to display positions 
00274   of bodies, and equal to "high" when we want to display computed force vectors of bodies. */
00275 FMB_INLINE void pos_xyz_Display(FMB_CONST COORDINATES_T pos_x, 
00276                                 FMB_CONST COORDINATES_T pos_y, 
00277                                 FMB_CONST COORDINATES_T pos_z,

00281

00284     fprintf(f, ", ");
00285     fprintf(f, LOW_PRECISION_DOUBLE_FPRINTF, pos_y);
00286     fprintf(f, ", ");
00287     fprintf(f, LOW_PRECISION_DOUBLE_FPRINTF, pos_z);
00288   }
00289   else {
00290     fprintf(f, HIGH_PRECISION_DOUBLE_FPRINTF, pos_x);
00291     fprintf(f, ", ");
00292     fprintf(f, HIGH_PRECISION_DOUBLE_FPRINTF, pos_y);
00293     fprintf(f, ", ");
00294     fprintf(f, HIGH_PRECISION_DOUBLE_FPRINTF, pos_z);
00295   }
00296   
00297   fprintf(f, ")");
00298 }

00303 FMB_INLINE bool position_Are_relative_corner_positions_correct(position_t *p_corner0_position,
00304                                                                position_t *p_corner1_position){
00305   if ((position_Get_x(p_corner0_position) > position_Get_x(p_corner1_position))
00306       || (position_Get_y(p_corner0_position) > position_Get_y(p_corner1_position))
00307       || (position_Get_z(p_corner0_position) > position_Get_z(p_corner1_position)))
00308     return FALSE;
00309   else
00310     return TRUE;
00311 }

00321 /*********************************************************************************************

00325 /*! The two following functions are also used for the complex numbers implementation. */
00326 /*! This function gives the value in the range ]-Pi, Pi] which equals "a" modulo 2*Pi. */ 
00327 FMB_INLINE COORDINATES_T angle_Convert_in_MinusPi_Pi(COORDINATES_T a){
00328   COORDINATES_T res = FMB_FMOD(a, 2*M_PI);
00329   /* "res" is now in the range ]-2 Pi, 2 Pi[ */
00330   if (res > M_PI)
00331     res -= 2*M_PI;
00332 
00333   /* There might be something to do : "<=" is not very relevant for floating point numbers ....*/
00334 
00335   if (res < -M_PI + EPSILON) /* that is to say: if (res <= -M_PI) */
00336     res += 2*M_PI;
00337   /* "res" is now in the range ]Pi, Pi] */
00338   return res;
00339 }
00340 /*! Computes arctan(y/x) and returns a result in the range ]-Pi, Pi]: */
00341 FMB_INLINE COORDINATES_T angle_Compute_from_cartesian(COORDINATES_T x, 
00342                                                       COORDINATES_T y){
00343   /* It might be better to avoid the call to angle_Convert_in_MinusPi_Pi() 
00344      against additional tests on the sign of y ... */
00345 
00346   /* Remark : the result will be in the range [-Pi, Pi] \n 
00347      and atan returns values in the range [-Pi/2, Pi/2]. */ 
00348 /*   if (FMB_FABS(x) > (COORDINATES_T) EPSILON) */
00349 /*     return angle_Convert_in_MinusPi_Pi(atan(y/x) + ((x > (COORDINATES_T) 0) ? 0 : M_PI)); */
00350 /*   else */
00351 /*     return ((y < (COORDINATES_T) 0) ? -M_PI_2 : M_PI_2); */
00352 
00353   return FMB_ATAN2(y, x);
00354 }

00358 
00359 FMB_INLINE COORDINATES_T spherical_position_Get_ph(FMB_CONST spherical_position_t *FMB_RESTRICT p){  
00360   return p->ph;  
00361 }  
00362 /*! The user do not need to ensure that v is in the range ]-Pi, Pi].
00363   spherical_position_Set_ph() will automatically set phi to
00364   a value in the range ]-Pi, Pi]. */
00365 FMB_INLINE void spherical_position_Set_ph(spherical_position_t *FMB_RESTRICT p, 
00366                                           COORDINATES_T v){   
00367   p->ph = angle_Convert_in_MinusPi_Pi(v);
00368 }   
00369 /*! It is up to the user to ensure that v is in the range ]-Pi, Pi]. */
00370 FMB_INLINE void spherical_position_Set_ph_not_safe(spherical_position_t *FMB_RESTRICT p,
00371                                                    COORDINATES_T v){   
00372 #ifdef _DEBUG_ 
00373   if (v>M_PI || v<=-M_PI){
00374     FMB_error("ERROR: in spherical_position_Set_ph_not_safe() v is not in the range ]-Pi,Pi].\n");
00375   }
00376 #endif /* #ifdef _DEBUG_ */
00377   p->ph = v;
00378 }   
00379 
00380 
00381 FMB_INLINE COORDINATES_T spherical_position_Get_th(FMB_CONST spherical_position_t *FMB_RESTRICT p){  
00382   return p->th;  
00383 }  
00384 FMB_INLINE void spherical_position_Set_th(spherical_position_t *FMB_RESTRICT p, 
00385                                           COORDINATES_T v){   
00386   /* theta must be in the range [0, Pi]: */
00387   p->th = FMB_FMOD(v, 2*M_PI); /* theta is now in the range ]-2 Pi, 2 Pi[ */
00388 
00389   if (p->th < 0.0)
00390     p->th += 2*M_PI; /* theta is now in the range [0, 2 Pi[ */
00391 
00392   if (p->th > M_PI){
00393 /* if (INFO_DISPLAY(3)){ */
00394 /*     fprintf(stderr,  */
00395 /*          "WARNING: p->th > Pi in spherical_position_Set_th => modifying p->ph too !!\n");  */
00396 /* } */
00397     p->th = 2*M_PI - p->th;
00398     spherical_position_Set_ph(p, spherical_position_Get_ph(p) + M_PI);
00399   }
00400 }   
00401 
00402 
00403 FMB_INLINE COORDINATES_T spherical_position_Get_r(FMB_CONST spherical_position_t *FMB_RESTRICT p){  
00404   return p->r;  
00405 }  
00406 FMB_INLINE void spherical_position_Set_r(spherical_position_t *FMB_RESTRICT p, 
00407                                          COORDINATES_T v){   
00408   if (v < (COORDINATES_T) 0){
00409 /* if (INFO_DISPLAY(3)){ */
00410 /*     fprintf(stderr,  */
00411 /*          "WARNING: p->r < 0 in spherical_position_Set_r => modifying p->ph and p->th too !!\n");  */
00412 /* } */
00413     p->r = -v;
00414     spherical_position_Set_ph(p, M_PI - spherical_position_Get_th(p));
00415     spherical_position_Set_th(p, spherical_position_Get_th(p) + M_PI);
00416   }
00417   else 
00418     p->r = v;   
00419 }  
00420 
00421 
00422 /*! Use the following function whenever it is possible (instead of 3 calls           \n
00423   to: spherical_position_Set_r(), spherical_position_Set_th() and                    \n
00424   spherical_position_Set_ph()) or be sure to call the 3 functions in the same        \n
00425   order as the one used in the definition of spherical_position_Set_r_th_ph()!       */ 
00426 FMB_INLINE void spherical_position_Set_r_th_ph(spherical_position_t *FMB_RESTRICT p,
00427                                                COORDINATES_T r_value,
00428                                                COORDINATES_T th_value,
00429                                                COORDINATES_T ph_value){
00430   /* We have to call spherical_position_Set_ph() before spherical_position_Set_th() 
00431      since spherical_position_Set_th() might modify the "ph" field, 
00432      and we have to call spherical_position_Set_r() at the end since it 
00433      might modify the fields "th" and "ph" ... */
00434   spherical_position_Set_ph(p, ph_value);
00435   spherical_position_Set_th(p, th_value);
00436   spherical_position_Set_r(p, r_value);
00437 }
00438 /*! "not_safe" is only for "ph". */
00439 FMB_INLINE void spherical_position_Set_r_th_ph_not_safe(spherical_position_t *FMB_RESTRICT p,
00440                                                         COORDINATES_T r_value,
00441                                                         COORDINATES_T th_value,
00442                                                         COORDINATES_T ph_value){
00443   /* We have to call spherical_position_Set_ph() before spherical_position_Set_th() 
00444      since spherical_position_Set_th() might modify the "ph" field, 
00445      and we have to call spherical_position_Set_r() at the end since it 
00446      might modify the fields "th" and "ph" ... */
00447   spherical_position_Set_ph_not_safe(p, ph_value);
00448   spherical_position_Set_th(p, th_value);
00449   spherical_position_Set_r(p, r_value);
00450 }
00451 
00452 
00453 FMB_INLINE void spherical_position_2cartesian(FMB_CONST spherical_position_t *FMB_RESTRICT p_sphe,  
00454                                               position_t *FMB_RESTRICT p_cart){ 
00455   position_Set_x(p_cart,  
00456                  spherical_position_Get_r(p_sphe) * FMB_COS(spherical_position_Get_ph(p_sphe)) * FMB_SIN(spherical_position_Get_th(p_sphe))); 
00457   position_Set_y(p_cart,  
00458                  spherical_position_Get_r(p_sphe) * FMB_SIN(spherical_position_Get_ph(p_sphe)) * FMB_SIN(spherical_position_Get_th(p_sphe))); 
00459   position_Set_z(p_cart,  
00460                  spherical_position_Get_r(p_sphe) * FMB_COS(spherical_position_Get_th(p_sphe))); 
00461 } 
00462 
00463 FMB_INLINE void position_2spherical(FMB_CONST position_t *FMB_RESTRICT p_cart,  
00464                                     spherical_position_t *FMB_RESTRICT p_sphe){ 
00465   /* Remark: the use of spherical_position_Set_r_th_ph[_not_safe] is not very           \n
00466      convenient here, but we take care of calling the functions in the right order.     */ 
00467 
00468   /* We have to call spherical_position_Set_r() before spherical_position_Set_th but 
00469      there is no problem since sqrt(...) will always be positive! */
00470   spherical_position_Set_r(p_sphe,  
00471                            FMB_SQRT((position_Get_x(p_cart) * position_Get_x(p_cart)) + 
00472                                 (position_Get_y(p_cart) * position_Get_y(p_cart)) + 
00473                                 (position_Get_z(p_cart) * position_Get_z(p_cart))));
00474   
00475   spherical_position_Set_ph_not_safe(p_sphe, 
00476                                      angle_Compute_from_cartesian(position_Get_x(p_cart),
00477                                                                   position_Get_y(p_cart)));
00478   
00479   /* Remark : "th" (i.e. "theta") is in the range [0, Pi]   \n
00480      and acos returns values in this range.                 */
00481   /* What if r==0.0 ???????????????????????????????????????????? */
00482   spherical_position_Set_th(p_sphe, 
00483                             FMB_ACOS(position_Get_z(p_cart) / spherical_position_Get_r(p_sphe)));
00484 }  
00485 
00486 
00487 FMB_INLINE void position_2_r_cos_th_sin_th_ph(FMB_CONST position_t *FMB_RESTRICT p_cart,
00488                                               REAL_T *p_r,
00489                                               REAL_T *p_cos_th,
00490                                               REAL_T *p_sin_th,
00491                                               REAL_T *p_ph){
00492   COORDINATES_T x2_plus_y2 = (position_Get_x(p_cart) * position_Get_x(p_cart)) + 
00493     (position_Get_y(p_cart) * position_Get_y(p_cart));
00494 
00495   *p_r = FMB_SQRT( x2_plus_y2 + (position_Get_z(p_cart) * position_Get_z(p_cart)));
00496   *p_ph = angle_Compute_from_cartesian(position_Get_x(p_cart), position_Get_y(p_cart));
00497   /* cos_th = z/r */
00498   *p_cos_th = position_Get_z(p_cart) / *p_r;
00499   /* sin_th = sqrt(x^2 + y^2)/r */
00500   *p_sin_th = FMB_SQRT(x2_plus_y2) / *p_r;
00501 }
00502 
00503 
00504 
00505 /*! This function returns in *p_rel the relative spherical coordinates \n
00506   of the *p_abs absolute coordinates with regard to *p_new_origin. */ 
00507 FMB_INLINE void spherical_position_Compute_relative_coordinates(FMB_CONST spherical_position_t *FMB_RESTRICT p_abs,
00508                                                                 FMB_CONST spherical_position_t *FMB_RESTRICT p_new_origin,
00509                                                                 spherical_position_t *FMB_RESTRICT p_rel){
00510   /***** First method: *****/
00511   /* We convert to cartesian positions, compute the relative position in cartesian
00512      coordinates and convert back to spherical coordinates. */
00513   /*   position_t abs_cart, new_origin_cart, rel_cart; */
00514   /*   spherical_position_2cartesian(p_abs, &abs_cart); */
00515   /*   spherical_position_2cartesian(p_new_origin, &new_origin_cart); */
00516   /*   position_Negate(&new_origin_cart); */
00517   /*   position_Add(&abs_cart, &new_origin_cart); */
00518   /*   position_2spherical(&abs_cart, p_rel); */
00519   
00520 
00521 
00522   /***** Second method: *****/
00523   /* P = (r, theta, phi) (=*p_new_origin)
00524      Q = (rho, alpha, beta) (=*p_abs)
00525      We want to compute the relative coordinates (rho', alpha', beta') 
00526      (=*p_rel) of Q with regard to P:
00527      - rho' = sqrt(r^2 + rho^2 - 2*r*rho*cos(gamma)
00528        ou cos(gamma) = cos(theta)*cos(alpha) + sin(theta)*sin(alpha)*cos(phi-beta)
00529      - alpha' = arccos( (rho*cos(alpha) - r*cos(theta)) / rho' )
00530      - beta' = ... no easy way: I choose to use the cartesian coordinates ...
00531   */
00532   COORDINATES_T x_tmp, y_tmp;
00533 
00534   /* Remark: the use of spherical_position_Set_r_th_ph[_not_safe] is not very           \n
00535      convenient here, but we take care of calling the functions in the right order.     */ 
00536 
00537   /* Computing of rho': */
00538   COORDINATES_T cos_gamma = FMB_COS(spherical_position_Get_th(p_new_origin))*FMB_COS(spherical_position_Get_th(p_abs)) + FMB_SIN(spherical_position_Get_th(p_new_origin))*FMB_SIN(spherical_position_Get_th(p_abs))*FMB_COS(spherical_position_Get_ph(p_new_origin) - spherical_position_Get_ph(p_abs));
00539 
00540   /* We have to call spherical_position_Set_r() before spherical_position_Set_th but 
00541      there is no problem since sqrt(...) will always be positive! */
00542   spherical_position_Set_r(p_rel, 
00543                            FMB_SQRT(spherical_position_Get_r(p_new_origin)*spherical_position_Get_r(p_new_origin) + spherical_position_Get_r(p_abs)*spherical_position_Get_r(p_abs) - 2*spherical_position_Get_r(p_new_origin)*spherical_position_Get_r(p_abs)*cos_gamma));
00544 
00545   /* Computing of beta': */
00546   /* We do not use spherical_position_2cartesian() and position_2spherical() 
00547      since we do not need the coordinate along the z-axis. */
00548   x_tmp = spherical_position_Get_r(p_abs) * FMB_COS(spherical_position_Get_ph(p_abs)) * FMB_SIN(spherical_position_Get_th(p_abs)); 
00549   y_tmp = spherical_position_Get_r(p_abs) * FMB_SIN(spherical_position_Get_ph(p_abs)) * FMB_SIN(spherical_position_Get_th(p_abs));
00550   /* Computing relative cartesian coordinates along the x-axis and the y-axis: */
00551   x_tmp -= spherical_position_Get_r(p_new_origin) * FMB_COS(spherical_position_Get_ph(p_new_origin)) * FMB_SIN(spherical_position_Get_th(p_new_origin));
00552   y_tmp -= spherical_position_Get_r(p_new_origin) * FMB_SIN(spherical_position_Get_ph(p_new_origin)) * FMB_SIN(spherical_position_Get_th(p_new_origin));
00553   /* Back to spherical: */
00554   spherical_position_Set_ph_not_safe(p_rel, 
00555                                      angle_Compute_from_cartesian(x_tmp, y_tmp));
00556 
00557   /* Computing of alpha': */
00558   /* Remark : alpha' is in the range [0, Pi] \n  
00559      and acos returns values in this range. */ 
00560   spherical_position_Set_th(p_rel, 
00561                             FMB_ACOS((spherical_position_Get_r(p_abs)*FMB_COS(spherical_position_Get_th(p_abs)) - spherical_position_Get_r(p_new_origin)*FMB_COS(spherical_position_Get_th(p_new_origin))) / spherical_position_Get_r(p_rel)));
00562   
00563 }
00564 
00565 
00566 /*! 
00567   - *p_center_of_local_base are the spherical coordinates of the center of the local 
00568   base of the spherical coordinates.
00569   - *p_pos_in_local_base are the cartesian coordinates of the vector in the local base 
00570   of the spherical coordinates.
00571   - *p_result will contain (at the return of the function) the cartesian coordinate of
00572   the vector in the "usual" base of the cartesian coordinates centred in the origin.
00573 */
00574 FMB_INLINE void spherical_position_Compute_cartesian_from_local_base(FMB_CONST spherical_position_t *FMB_RESTRICT p_center_of_local_base,
00575                                                                      FMB_CONST position_t *FMB_RESTRICT p_pos_in_local_base,
00576                                                                      position_t *FMB_RESTRICT p_result){
00577 
00578   /* The local base is:
00579      - e_r = ( cos(phi).sin(theta), sin(phi).sin(theta), cos(theta))
00580      - e_theta = ( cos(phi).cos(theta), sin(phi).cos(theta), -sin(theta))  (i.e. theta -> theta + Pi/2 )
00581      - e_phi = ( -sin(phi), cos(phi), 0)  (i.e. theta=0 and phi -> phi + Pi/2 )
00582   */
00583 
00584   /* This can be written as a matrix product:
00585      
00586    [ f_x ]    [ cos(phi).sin(theta)  cos(phi).cos(theta)  -sin(phi) ]   [ f_r     ]
00587    [ f_y ]  = [ sin(phi).sin(theta)  sin(phi).cos(theta)  cos(phi)  ] . [ f_theta ]
00588    [ f_z ]    [ cos(theta)           -sin(theta)          0         ]   [ f_phi   ]
00589   
00590    with (f_x, f_y, f_z) = *p_result 
00591    and  (f_r, f_theta, f_phi) = *p_pos_in_local_base
00592    and theta = spherical_position_Get_th(p_center_of_local_base)
00593    and phi = spherical_position_Get_ph(p_center_of_local_base)
00594   */
00595 
00596   COORDINATES_T cos_theta = FMB_COS(spherical_position_Get_th(p_center_of_local_base));
00597   COORDINATES_T cos_phi = FMB_COS(spherical_position_Get_ph(p_center_of_local_base));
00598   COORDINATES_T sin_theta = FMB_SIN(spherical_position_Get_th(p_center_of_local_base));
00599   COORDINATES_T sin_phi = FMB_SIN(spherical_position_Get_ph(p_center_of_local_base));
00600 
00601   position_Set_x(p_result, 
00602                  cos_phi * sin_theta * position_Get_x(p_pos_in_local_base) + 
00603                  cos_phi * cos_theta * position_Get_y(p_pos_in_local_base) + 
00604                  (-sin_phi) * position_Get_z(p_pos_in_local_base));
00605 
00606   position_Set_y(p_result,
00607                  sin_phi * sin_theta * position_Get_x(p_pos_in_local_base) +
00608                  sin_phi * cos_theta * position_Get_y(p_pos_in_local_base) +
00609                  cos_phi * position_Get_z(p_pos_in_local_base));
00610 
00611   position_Set_z(p_result,
00612                  cos_theta * position_Get_x(p_pos_in_local_base) +
00613                  (-sin_theta) * position_Get_y(p_pos_in_local_base));
00614 }
00615 
00616 
00617 FMB_INLINE void spherical_position_Display(FMB_CONST spherical_position_t *FMB_RESTRICT p,
00618                                            FILE *f){
00619   fprintf(f, "(r=");
00620   fprintf(f, LOW_PRECISION_DOUBLE_FPRINTF, spherical_position_Get_r(p));
00621   fprintf(f, ", th=");
00622   fprintf(f, LOW_PRECISION_DOUBLE_FPRINTF, spherical_position_Get_th(p));
00623   fprintf(f, ", ph=");
00624   fprintf(f, LOW_PRECISION_DOUBLE_FPRINTF, spherical_position_Get_ph(p));
00625   fprintf(f, ")");
00626 }
